history.text: hello, what is the movie that you read about?
Zootopia. Are you familiar with it?
Slightly, I think I watched it with my girls. Anything interesting  you read in the article about it?
The main character, Judy Hopps (a rabbit) was the police academy valedictorian.
The characters looks past their species stereotypes
Sometimes the stereotypes are true but they still try to work around them.
I think I remember that character, and that scenario. It sounds like a good kids movie for sure. I know my children loved it.
It got a score of 98% on Rotten Tomatoes
that is interesting
I wouldn't have guessed it would have rated so well
Yes especially being an animated kid's movie
Well kids movies can be good
They just have to have a good plot to them, something that everyone can get into
Yes very true.
Have you seen the movie?
One of the lessons in this movie is that Judy learned from Nick (I believe he was the fox) he was bullied as a kid because he was stereotyped as being untrustworthy.
Yes I saw it at the theatre. Seems like it's been a while
That is actually a good lesson for kids. Stereotypes, we all try our best not to do it to people, but we do it.
Yes unfortunately you are exactly right
If we have a general understanding of one another, we can overcome those stereotypes
The information I have on the side is just adding more details. Since you've seen it it's tough for me to convince you.
Do you usually watch animated films?
I don't remember it too much anyways. I have 3 daughters, and the youngest is 2, so I watch a lot of Disney Jr
My older two are 7 and 8, they watch more of the Disney movies, and family type movies
I see. I remember those days well. Yes same. My daughter is 9.
I guess one of the other big points of this movie is that it pays off to work hard and stick to your guns even when it's not easy
And you can't judge a book by it's cover.
Yeah, I think you are right
I like movies that have some life lessons in them
It makes them more interesting to follow.
Yes me too. Especially for kids because then you can discuss them later also
For sure, anything you can interact with them about after is important.
If I hadn't seen the movie, I would definitely be interested based on your description
It's tough to compress it into a few words because the descriptions are so long.
I think there are a lot of lessons in the movie for sure.
yeah, it is okay. You did good, and the movie was good :)

uid2response.feedback: The other user was great at picking out points of the movie that would make me want to watch the movie with my family! He actively discussed with me, and I enjoyed our conversation.
